website_summaries.verdict: Top-notch precision sewing scissors from a well-respected manufacturer in the field.
pros: Compact, yet sharp and durable sewing scissors that are perfect for detail work
We love that the ergonomic rubber grip handles are comfortable to use, even during long sewing sessions
cons: Blades are too small to take on most regular cutting tasks

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little scissors
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little scissors! Razor sharp. They are helping feed my pom pom-making obsession but in a good way. They are short little things so you wouldn't want them for cutting fabric of any great lengths. But for small, sharp, clean snips. these are perfect! Plus much less expensive than Michael's or Hobby Lobby.
customer_reviews.author: Sciakath

customer_reviews.title: Great scissors if you need to get into tight places
customer_reviews.text: A lot of scissors wont cut right on the tip. These do. I bought them to cut fine silky hair between the paw pads of my Pappion dog. They will nip off just a few stringy pieces with ease. Dispite being so sharp, they are actually safer because I can nip off just a few hairs and they are sharp enough to cut on the tip so Im not shoving scissor in farther to find a cutting spot. Love these little scissors for lose threads too.
customer_reviews.author: Politically what?

customer_reviews.title: Smooth-Working, Extremely Sharp Scissors
customer_reviews.text: Love these Singer scissors - in fact, I'm ordering two more pairs. They work extremely smoothly, and the blades are sharp, sharp, sharp - just what I needed for my cross-stitch work, and the size of the scissors is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sharp
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sharp! Handles worsted acrylic as well as worsted cotton with ease. Shame it doesn't come with a sheath though. I can always MacGyver one up with some tape or whatever, but it's not the most elegant solution.
customer_reviews.author: ZacceaTop Contributor: Knitting

customer_reviews.title: I keep buying more
customer_reviews.text: You can never have enough scissors. These are great and trust me I've abused these and after a little wash in sink and drying with paper towel they work great. And because my hands are kind of messed up I can't use something much bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Beth Crowther

customer_reviews.title: The tips will not snip thread
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to trim small threads and pieces of yarn but the tips don't come together correctly, therefore I am not able to use them for my intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 12 pair of embroidery scissors since starting my embroidery business last year. and none even come close to comparing to these! I actually bought two pair of these and they are the only ones I use. (The other inferior pairs all sit in a drawer.) These scissors have a very sharp micro tip that allow incredibly close cuts. Two thumbs waaay up for these!
customer_reviews.author: jbug

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: I do paper sculpting, I guess that is what you call it lol but I cut a bunch a little bits with these scissors and they have help up pretty good and I think they are made for sewing so I can't dog them out at all but do have to give them 4 stars because they don't snip things off at the very end but again I'm cutting card stock but if they have held up to a lot of that then they much be pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: MrWheelchairGuy

customer_reviews.title: Nice and very sharp and most importantly the finger area ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice and very sharp and most importantly the finger area is roomy enough for my fingers where it is comfortable to do a lot of cutting without it digging in. I also have the Gingher crane embroidery scissors but the finger areas are too small that it really hurt after longer use. The Singer is my replacement for the Gingher.
customer_reviews.author: Smuffins

customer_reviews.title: Nice little scissors
customer_reviews.text: These are very small scissors that I purchased to keep in my crochet bag. They are perfect for this use and any where you don’t need a large cutting surface. I wouldn’t attempt to use them to cut fabric or other large sewing projects, but for mending and small crafts they are just right and very sharp. **Update** They are decent little scissors but if you need them to cut well at the tip for close detail work, spring for the extra dollar and buy the Fiskars. I bought these to replace a pair of Fiskars that I misplaced and recently found. When compared, the Singer come up short.
customer_reviews.author: dbest57

customer_reviews.title: Terrible and useless!!
customer_reviews.text: This are the worst scissors ever. The tips don’t cut anything. After cutting some strands of yarn (yes I’m making Pom poms and though these would be perfect) they won’t cut at all. They function more as a dull saw. I rarely leave bad reviews on amazon products but these were VERY disappointing!! Had I not tossed the packaging I would have made the effort to go to the post office and return them!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sharp to the tip
customer_reviews.text: Sharp, but not sharp to the tip. I'd hoped to use these scissors to cut detail cuts in paper designs. Any cheap made in China Fiskars would have worked the same.
customer_reviews.author: Lainy

customer_reviews.title: Great small sewing or craft scissors!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these craft sewing scissors. I kept one pair fir myself :-) I’ve used it to do crafting, cutting patterns, making pon poms, cutting felt and fabric. I won’t use these for routine paper cutting because that generally dulls the blades and I also like full size scissors for that. These are very sharp also which I like. I put the gift pair with a sewing kit for a seamstress friend and I’m sure she will enjoy these easy-to-use scissors as much as I do. Hope this review was useful.
customer_reviews.author: kcdctx22

customer_reviews.title: Started off very sharp, but dulled quickly
customer_reviews.text: I really liked these little scissors when I first got them. They were nice and sharp, and quickly cut through thread and yarns. Unfortunately, they got dull pretty quickly. After just a couple of weeks, they don’t cut through threads and yarn very well. I sometimes have to cut twice. And it’s not as if I used these every day. I would say I had moderate use of them. They are maneuverable, however. That part I did like about them. It’s too bad that they don’t last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly a precision ‘to the tip’ cut
customer_reviews.text: These are nice trimming scissors, but the nano tip isn’t really as advertised. It does not cut right to the tip. They are comfortable and great for cutting threads while sewing, trimming fine seams, etc, but if you need a precision to the tip cut, these don’t really work well. I ended up buying some Italian made scissors that do precision ‘to the tip’ cut. It’s important when putting in zippered pockets on purses. I like these and would buy them again for general use, but I’ll stick to the more expensive ones for the precision cuts.
customer_reviews.author: LadyO

customer_reviews.title: Great Scissors
customer_reviews.text: I've had a pair of these scissors for years. They still work well. I wanted another for downstairs but hadn't been able to find this particular model in the stores. Then I checked Amazon. Not only were they available in pink (which is what I had) but also in turquoise, which I bought this time. I highly recommend these. They cut well. Mine never have been sharpened and still work well. I use them for paper, fabric, and just general cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Mac

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for using around the sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: If all you need is a little snip snip, these scissors are for you. Excellent for using around the sewing machine. I needed a little pair of scissors that had a sharp tip to snip little threads close to the material. These scissors sure do fit the bill. Very pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Great for Detail Work!
customer_reviews.text: I use mine for cutting the edges of fabric for a rag quilt. They are very sharp at the tip and makes my cutting easy. The handle is soft and doesn't hurt your hand after cutting for long periods. Most of all you can't beat the price. Some of the scissors made for cutting the rag quilts are $20 +. I also do applique and these work great for small precise cutting. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Sue G.

customer_reviews.title: The Size Counts
customer_reviews.text: These scissors are small but mighty. Great for getting in tight places with Nano tip. Easy to use and maneuver in fabric. Excellent quality and price. 5 Big Ones *****
customer_reviews.author: Republic66

customer_reviews.title: Broke after minimal use
customer_reviews.text: I eused these twice. They are great, until they broke.
customer_reviews.author: KatherineS

customer_reviews.title: I need to buy more....
customer_reviews.text: These have become my favorite scissors. Good cut. Feels good in my hand. Don't gum up cutting vinyl. It is really tempting to use them for everything, but I try to save the blades and use them only when I need a super clean cut.
customer_reviews.author: N.Krawler

customer_reviews.title: Multipurpose scissors
customer_reviews.text: These are sharp little scissors and I liked the first one so much that I purchased a second pair. I keep one pair in my sewing basket for clipping threads and seams and the second pair in my craft room for cutting paper and cardstock. The handles are large enough to comfortably use without digging into your thumb.
customer_reviews.author: September MorneTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: The tip of the scissor doesn’t meet to make a complete cut
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to be a detail scissor but when I cut a V the tip of the scissor doesn’t close all the way so it doesn’t make a complete cut I returned
customer_reviews.author: mideco

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little Scissors
customer_reviews.text: At first, I hesitated thinking these would be too small for my big hands and fingers. Boy was I wrong. They fit my fat fingers perfectly, and they are easy to use, and they have just the right sharpness for what I needed them for. I replaced my other small scissors with these and I'm so happy I did. The price was amazing also I got them for under 6 dollars. The only small gripe I have is I wish I could have got them in a different color. White or black would've been my preferred color. Otherwise, well worth the cost and awesome to use. Buy them now...stop reading and buy them lol.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff webb

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, close cut, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are the best for snipping the small threads left during embroidery. The small design makes them easy to get close to the stitches for a clean cut. They stay sharp too. The padded handles makes them comfortable as well. I’m always misplacing mine so I ordered a second pair as back up.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget K

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, small sewing scissors - great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect sewing/craft scissors. I use them for cross stitch. The blades are small enough to get close to the stitches to snip off the ends of threads. They seem sturdy enough to last for awhile and the blades were nice and sharp.
customer_reviews.author: K Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great as yarn snips, worth getting when they're on sale
customer_reviews.text: Sharp enough to cut through thick yarn quickly, and cheap enough as a Deal of the Day that it wasn't much more expensive than the kid's school scissors I normally use as yarn snips. I don't sew that much and haven't travelled by air in years, so I can't speak to those aspects of using these in needlecrafts -- but as yarn snips, they're great!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine A. McClarey

customer_reviews.title: Very Expensive, Great working, sharp pair of scissors
customer_reviews.text: These are great little scissors. Cuts good & love them for thread and sewing projects. I “don’t know what happened to them but had them in their package for storage & the thumb hole cracked half way.” Could it be Florida humidity, heat? Duct tape covers crack till a new pair is ordered. I like these! Went to buy another pair of these & they were $5.50 before, now they are $23.00! WTH! What the heck! These are small sharp scissors but not worth $23.00, too easy to break.
customer_reviews.author: vick

customer_reviews.title: I've had them over a year! - still sharp, still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I've had these great little scissors for over a year (I can't believe I neglected to write a review!) and I still absolutely love them! They are sharp, easy to hold and use, and they have held up very well! Added bonus is the price! Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: D-M-R

customer_reviews.title: Good reliable quality
customer_reviews.text: These scissors are very sharp I have been using threds snips for a while, the spring loaded kind. I found that they dull rather fast, so rather then buying more I decided to get a quality pair of snips with handles. the only thing I don't like is that the fabric doesn't bounce off of the scissors the way it does with snips so sometimes I will have to shake off the threads from the scissors. however if they are very easy to use the finger holes are big enough and best of all I can resharpen these easily when they full. I would definitely recommend at this price it's a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Elisa

customer_reviews.title: Incredible scissors
customer_reviews.text: Incredible scissors. I wish I'd discovered these scissors years ago. I make heirloom felt Christmas stockings and tree skirts, there are many small delicate pieces to be cut and it's always been a struggle to find scissors that snip sharply right to the tip. These scissors cut clean and sharp and are a delight to use. I also sew and quilt and these scissors cut sharp and precise.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Luymes

customer_reviews.title: Great for small jobs!
customer_reviews.text: I have an expanding 1/6 figure collection. Every now and then, I will find a loose thread on their outfit or my own clothes. I keep these exclusively for small snips here and there. Nothing fancy! They have a very precise cut and feel great to hold. I also really like the blue color! I'd like to get the bigger scissors sometime for the larger projects after experiencing these.
customer_reviews.author: JS1124

customer_reviews.title: The best scissors I have ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: These are easily the best scissors ever. They are great for fussy cutting. Be careful. They are VERY sharp pointed. I have actually stabbed about a half an inch in my leg on accident with these.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp, but they already broke!
customer_reviews.text: I used these scissors to cut loose strings and small packages and cut little plastic ties off clothing. Used very lightly. Today I went to cut those plastic ties off a pair of socks and the scissor broke in half. The plastic part where your fingers are placed totally broke. I didn't use much pressure so I found this very odd. I placed the order for these in May 2019 and didn't even get a full year out of them. I would like to return them but im unsure how.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S.

customer_reviews.title: WORK WELL.....
customer_reviews.text: I received ahead of time and was happy with my purchase. The SMALL TEAL & BLACK SINGER SCISSORS are very sharp and cut satin ribbons beautifully. I also needed them for fussy cutting already printed pictures and designs as i make alot of cards and they worked great. They are ok for being comfortable only. I do recommend them for the price! ENJOY ALL & STAY SAFE!!!
customer_reviews.author: KRIS TENNESSEN

customer_reviews.title: Paper Crafting: Approved!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for working with paper, primarily photo paper. Absolutely fantastic. Slightly awkward to hold initially, but you can work around it and adjust your grip as needed to get the right cut. Impressive quality and clean cuts—will probably buy again, there is no going back to my other scissors after trying out these bad boys!
customer_reviews.author: Midwest CraftyLass

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and Reliable - Fiskars Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp, reliable, sturdy, and nice rubber grips. I use these to cut up greens before I use them. I would reccomend these for purchase as I chose to give this company a chance over Fiskars (which I am a big fan of) because of the price difference. In my opinion exactly as advertised at the lowest price point when I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Billal Murtaza

customer_reviews.title: great deal!
customer_reviews.text: excellent little scissors for fine work in sewing. great value! April 2020 update: bought another pair here, via Amazon, good price, great little product, wanted 2 pairs so when I shift about from sewing machine to other side of table, wouldn't have to constantly move scissors back and forth to use.
customer_reviews.author: Fran McL

customer_reviews.title: SMALL AND SHARP
customer_reviews.text: I love these scissors! I purchased my second pair, one for upstairs and one for downstairs. They are small and very sharp. I use them to open boxes, packages, cut thread, plus many other uses. I'm would not recommend them for small children as they are sharp. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mary S

customer_reviews.title: Working great for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived early and exactly as shown. I use then to cut mats out of my cats fur. The pointed end gets into those tight areas. I do it when the cat is in a sqwiggy mood so he's calm. That prevents sudden movement so I don't have to worry about poking him. So much faster than using regular scissors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are NOT sharp to the tip!!
customer_reviews.text: The whole reason I bought these scissors was to cut notches at curved seams. You have to have scissors that are sharp all the way to the tip. But these are not - I had to recut every single notch to get the fabric to cut. Very disappointed. They feel good in the had, but that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: Cinder

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a scissors freak. Love me some sharp scissors. I usually only buy the pricey Gingher’s that I still have not unpacked since moving. I needed a small pair quickly and these are great. I have big hands for a girl and didn’t expect these to fit well, but surprisingly they do. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: Burges

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking
customer_reviews.text: Not very comfortable, and I have pretty small hands. The sliding action was slightly resistant. They broke (plastic handle shattered when trying to cut) after a couple month's use.
customer_reviews.author: Keeyab

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Sewing and Crafters Too!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for crafters and card makers too! I make greeting cards and sometimes need to fussy cut around a stamped image. These have sharp stainless steel blades and cut perfectly. I also do a lot of sewing, and these are great for trimming threads and frayed fabrics to get a clean edge. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Gina A.

customer_reviews.title: Great for cutting floss & thread
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old embroidery scissors with this pair. The black part is soft and comfortable. It makes precise, perfect cuts. The point is very sharp as well. They are reasonably priced so I won’t be too upset when I have to replace them because they somehow get used for other non-fabric crafts!
customer_reviews.author: Vault219

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp and precise.  Great for nipping threads.
customer_reviews.text: These scissors are very sharp and precise. I use them more for nipping threads and embroidery; and they nip right down to the stitch. I like them a wee more than my usual go to Fiskars brand (I still enjoy and use my Fiskars, but I think these scissors are sharper). In my opinion, you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: RMH

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp precision tip
customer_reviews.text: These little scissors are great! I make tiny things and these work perfectly. The tip is very small and sharp and the blades are set well, I've had some with uneven blades or spaces and returned them. I just bought 2 more pairs of these. For the price they can't be beat
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Best scissors for crafting w/ felt
customer_reviews.text: These are the most amazing scissors I've ever used. They are small, but so sharp and they cut all the way to the point. I've had a miserable time finding decent scissors for cutting details in felt and these are amazing. Just be careful you don't poke yourself as the tip is very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice scissors
customer_reviews.text: These little scissors are a good value but not if you're wanting something to cut intricate details in paper crafting. The tip isn't very pointy so I still have to use my other snips.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Perry

customer_reviews.title: good for trimming and precision cutting
customer_reviews.text: blade depth about 1 5/8 inch. perfect for tight spaces with minimal maneuverability.
customer_reviews.author: booshleeg

customer_reviews.title: These are super sharp NOT FOR KIDS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I fumbled these in my hands and dropped them. They stood straight up sticking in my hardwood floor. I fumbled them again and dropped them, I tried to catch them this time. They slit an inch and a half hole in my shirt and lacerated my chest...2 stitches!!
customer_reviews.author: Arika-wani

customer_reviews.title: nice and sharp
customer_reviews.text: these scissors have become my go to scissors. they are very sharp so that it makes tasks easier. small so don't take up a lot of space. I like that handle is covered and doesn't slip easily and colored so can be spotted quickly (I have a lot of stuff). am ordering another today.
customer_reviews.author: angela

customer_reviews.title: Small and Sharp...
customer_reviews.text: I really like these scissors, they are small, durable and are great for cutting out details. These scissors are very sharp and easy to control as your cutting. I would definitely buy more.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Nice and sharp.
customer_reviews.text: I use these scissors to cut yarn and they work great. Easy to use. Small finger holes so that doesn’t make them the most comfortable, but if you want small scissors, that’s what you get. I’m not using them for long periods of time anyway; just cutting threads as needed. I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using these for cutting waterslide decals, and theyve been excellent; no tugging or dragging while cutting.
customer_reviews.author: AshG

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Need a small pair of scissors just to cut threads and didn't want to pay the $10+ for scissors this size in the stores. Actually saw this same pair (different color) in the store after I received these and they were $12. Work perfect for snipping small threads.
customer_reviews.author: jg

customer_reviews.title: Cut very well
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp scissor which cut the thread very well. Wish the blades had some curve like the other scissors I have, so the sharp blades don't poke into the fabric when cut, but overall this is a nice/sharp scissor which I am sure I will be using a lot when I cut the thread.
customer_reviews.author: ako

customer_reviews.title: Scissors don't close fully when handles do.
customer_reviews.text: These are a good size and so far seem sharp but my pair have bad alignment; the handles meet before the blades fully close so the tips can't be used to cut and it is always a bit open. I wouldn't recommend these scissors due to this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby P.

customer_reviews.title: I love these!
customer_reviews.text: I love these scissors! They're my favorite embroidery scissors I have ever owned. Super sharp and with a very defined point. Makes it easy to cut very close. Also easy to get under stitches when you need to "frog." Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Farsong

customer_reviews.title: I use it daily.
customer_reviews.text: I am a paper crafting professional and needed a quality portable scissors suitable for cutting ribbon flawlessly. This turned out to be my favorite scissors for both studio and travel. I love the color and can quickly identify the scissors in my stash.
customer_reviews.author: T. A.

customer_reviews.title: Fine Cutting
customer_reviews.text: Great for all sorts of close and fine cutting needs. I purchased for snipping curves in sewing seams, but will also use for trimming threads. Will try not to use for cutting paper, but may have to purchase another pair for that!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little pair of scissors. The blades are sharp, the finger holes are large enough that my arthritic thumb and fingers fit comfortably. I keep them close by my recliner chair where I use them for cutting yarn and sewing threads from my handwork. The blades are a bit stiff, but not bad and with use they should loosen up a little. I trust the Singer brand and the price is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Marvetta King

customer_reviews.title: Handy scissors to have
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful little scissors. I would have given 5 stars, but the tips do not meet properly so I can not snip with the tips.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Brown

customer_reviews.title: DAMN, these are SHARP!
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for sharp when I ordered them and I got sharp! Beware, innocent fingers that get in the way. Great little scissors and they are even comfortable for this leftie. I have been using them to trim heavy upholstery fabric and they're holding up like champions.
customer_reviews.author: masala99

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love them. They are super sharp and work well ...
customer_reviews.text: I got these to use as kinda a seam ripper. I absolutely love them. They are super sharp and work well for what I needed. I would definitely recommend them to other crafters and will probably be buying myself another pair.
customer_reviews.author: K. LeeTop Contributor: Knitting

customer_reviews.title: Great scissors that are sharp, works with small detail cutting, and cuts a variety of paper
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for good quality scissors for cutting small pieces of paper for crafts. These did the trick. I plan to order the set of three so I can them in convenient places at home and at work. I will buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: E. Wyrick

customer_reviews.title: They do not close all the way
customer_reviews.text: Those scissors are fine but don't close all the way down! It's really annoying for detail work. They are really sharp and light, easy to use but the poitiness is useless since they won't cut unless almost halfway.
customer_reviews.author: Laëtitia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: The size and the precision of the pin point tip is perfect for all my hand cut crafting items. And small enough for easy travel.
customer_reviews.author: Susan G.

customer_reviews.title: I hide mine!
customer_reviews.text: And bought a second pair so that I have one for fabric and one for paper. I find them indispensable for fussy cutting and can't believe the low price. Maybe I should get a third pair before something happens lol.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly J.

customer_reviews.title: Very, very sharp
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my wife as she was making several masks for friends and family for the Covid-19 pandemic. She has been sewing for more than forty years and said these were the most comfortable and the sharpest scissor she has ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Rodbuilder

customer_reviews.title: Insanely sharp point
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not child friendly. Some adults might need to be cautious. I intended to keep them as bathroom scissors but now sometimes I keep them with me as protection. 🤷🏻‍♀️ Everything else is great.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Do not hold up well. Blades get loose. Non-adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Very dissappointed in this product. After limited use the blades get loose and will not cut, as the material goes between the blades. Totally non-adjustable so the blades cannot be tightened. I will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Thule1

customer_reviews.title: Best!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect supply for my bullet journal! Can cut washi tape easily as well as other clippings I want to add. Very sharp and can prob use for my sewing crafts too! Also it’s compact I can fit it in my little pencil bag.
customer_reviews.author: vmarie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a beginner embroidery
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my niece for her birthday. She wanted to have some embroidery supplies so I got her tons of stuff to start her off right. She said she loves them. Perfect for a experienced or beginner sewer or embroidery.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Beth

customer_reviews.title: Great small Scissors for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughter for cutting tape for hockey. We use them to cut hockey tape off the rounded end of the stick and to have in her bag for other needs. These are small. The blade is very small but perfect for our use. They are very sharp and cut clean.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy N.

customer_reviews.title: Sharp
customer_reviews.text: These little scissors are sharp. I purchased to use for cutting yarn while crocheting and knitting. They cut yarn like butter! They make my Fiskers look sad and pitiful. So glad I have them.
customer_reviews.author: J. hammer

customer_reviews.title: sharp and just perfect for my hand sewing needs
customer_reviews.text: These are great little scissors! I do a lot of knitting and these cut the yarn very easily. The are also wonderful when I am cutting the yarn for pompoms. I have had a struggle with other scissors not cutting through the multi layers of wound yarn.
customer_reviews.author: RAS

customer_reviews.title: Great Scissors for Sewing!
customer_reviews.text: I thought the scissors would be a bit bigger but surprisingly it was still very comfortable and really sharp! Love how small it is because I can easily cut through things precisely. Just repurchased so I have a second pair!
customer_reviews.author: Tina McConnell

customer_reviews.title: These scissors are amazing!! They are perfect for all of my ...
customer_reviews.text: These scissors are amazing!! They are perfect for all of my vinyl cutting needs. They are small and very sharp, allowing me to cut precisely.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Fann

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two pairs of these for a volunteer project I'm doing. I cut out about several sheets of detailed layered shapes of paper, muslin and fun foam. The scissors cut clean and got into corners really well. I did this for over an hour and my hands felt fine afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Resourceful House Elf

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp, perfect for embroidery. Also the perfect size to take in a carry on bag on a plane! I took them with me recently on a trip to work on my embroidery on the plane as these meet the four inch or less blade requirements. Overall highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: These get the job done
customer_reviews.text: These scissors have done an excellent job with everything I've needed them for , from clipping off a wild hair, to cutting open a plastic bag, snipping off a loose thread nice and close, and even cutting strips of duct tape. I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Great little scissors -- with a caution!
customer_reviews.text: These are great little scissors, but be careful. The tip is VERY sharp. I accidentally poked some little holes in my table. I didn't realize the tip was so sharp. But for close work on my quilt, they are very good.
customer_reviews.author: Reflady

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Like the scissors a lot. Easy to fit in an adults hand and very sharp and maneuverable. Wish I bought them long ago for making things.
customer_reviews.author: HParker

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp, perfect blades
customer_reviews.text: Super sharp blades, these are good for hair cutting or for sewing/crafting projects. I loved the color and size.. they fit perfectly in a to go bag for a project. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: lea90

customer_reviews.title: Not good for fishing line
customer_reviews.text: I gave 2 stars because I bought to cut braided fishing line and it just shreds the line and not cut it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim hartman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle and cut well
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 88-year-old mother-in-law. Her small scissors had fallen apart and she needed new ones. She loves these scissors. They are easy to handle and they cut well.
customer_reviews.author: L. Staley

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got these
customer_reviews.text: First I bought pretty scissors. And now I buy the good ones. This are sharp and accurate and last forever.
customer_reviews.author: LuvToReadTop Contributor: Cross-Stitch

customer_reviews.title: Quality pair of scissors
customer_reviews.text: Nice sharp well balanced little scissors for a great price. I have a variety of scissors collected throughout life time and these guys stack up to much more ecpensive german shears.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my sewing/knitting/crochet kits
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my sewing/knitting/crochet kits. The point is SHARP and allows for detailed snips, but sharp enough that I am careful to put them back in the case they stay in while I'm working on a project. I don't want to have puppy paws or upholstery accidents.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie T.

customer_reviews.title: Great for trimming candle wicks!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had grown tired of trying to trim our candles before lighting them. Finally I decided to try and find small scissors . FOUND THEM!!!! These are awesome!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great little scissors for my project. They seem to be of good quality, although they are Made in China...something we are trying to avoid in our purchases, whenever possible.
customer_reviews.author: Coco Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great for embroidery
customer_reviews.text: First day using these and I am in love. Perfect for cleaning up my embroidery work of all the timy jump stitches and hanging threads. Ordering a second pair to have when I misplace these.
customer_reviews.author: AdoreCustom

customer_reviews.title: Convenient to use at my sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: I have made over 200 masks, and these scissors work great at cutting the thread while working at my sewing machine. My big shears were just too big, and these are the perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle Mom

customer_reviews.title: very sharp and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about these scissors, but they were not expensive, so I thought I would try them. They are terrific. Very sharp, cuts through thread and fabric easily. Quick to put on and take off as you sew. Comfortable on the fingers. They will make a nice stocking stuffer this Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and small - Perfect for sewing tote
customer_reviews.text: Love the size - fits into my small purse size sewing kit I carry with me. Very sharp and recommend you be very careful with the point. Has a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Shorty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for your sewing kit.
customer_reviews.text: I thought they were a little cheap looking for Singer brand, but then again, they were not very expensive. This is my only reasoning for 4 instead of 5. They are very sharp and are great for my sewing kit.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and price!
customer_reviews.text: These are great scissors for doing detailed artwork. They were used in a very specialized art class for my daughter and I got a pair for our house based on that. Sturdy, sharp, very easy to manipulate and well-made. It’s a great deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to use if you have arthritis!
customer_reviews.text: Love these scissors! I have bad arthritis. Really bad in my hands. These r great for thread and yarn. Easy to hold and use. Don’t hurt like other scissors do. Comfortable handle and holes.
customer_reviews.author: Honey

customer_reviews.title: Handy Little Scissors
customer_reviews.text: I needed a smaller pair than my 5" scissors. These are sharp and easy to use. The price was great too.
customer_reviews.author: Latia H

product_meta.title: SINGER 00557 4-1/2-Inch ProSeries Detail Scissors with Nano Tip, Teal
product_meta.description: These small and precise 4 ½-inch detail scissors are made for professionals and sewing enthusiasts alike. The NANO Tip point of the shears is specially crafted for embroidery and detail work, and the rubberized comfort grip handles allow the user to craft without pinching or rubbing. The scissor blades have been individually inspected and hand-tested to ensure quality. Each pair comes with a lifetime guarantee.
feature_bullets: Small and precise detail scissors for the sewing enthusiast
Scissor blades have been individually inspected and hand tested to ensure quality
